description: The xenapi implementation of VM destroy is attempting to raise an "instance not present" exception if the VM does not exist.  It actually ends up failing to do even that, because the exception construction is referring to an undefined variable.
title: xenapi VM destroy fails gracelessly if VM is not present

comments.content: The xenapi implementation of VM destroy is attempting to raise an "instance not present" exception if the VM does not exist.  It actually ends up failing to do even that, because the exception construction is referring to an undefined variable.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ewanmellor
